    1: <?php
    2: /**
    3:  * SimplePie
    4:  *
    5:  * A PHP-Based RSS and Atom Feed Framework.
    6:  * Takes the hard work out of managing a complete RSS/Atom solution.
    7:  *
    8:  * Please note: This file is automatically generated by a build script. The
    9:  * full original source is always available from http://simplepie.org/
   10:  *
   11:  * Copyright (c) 2004-2012, Ryan Parman, Geoffrey Sneddon, Ryan McCue, and contributors
   12:  * All rights reserved.
   13:  *
   14:  * Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification, are
   15:  * permitted provided that the following conditions are met:
   16:  *
   17:  *  * Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list of
   18:  *    conditions and the following disclaimer.
   19:  *
   20:  *  * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this list
   21:  *    of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other materials
   22:  *    provided with the distribution.
   23:  *
   24:  *  * Neither the name of the SimplePie Team nor the names of its contributors may be used
   25:  *    to endorse or promote products derived from this software without specific prior
   26:  *    written permission.
   27:  *
   28:  * THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS
   29:  * OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY
   30:  * AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS
   31:  * AND CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR
   32:  * CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR
   33:  * SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY
   34:  * THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR
   35:  * OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE
   36:  * POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
   37:  *
   38:  * @package SimplePie
   39:  * @version 1.3-dev
   40:  * @copyright 2004-2012 Ryan Parman, Geoffrey Sneddon, Ryan McCue
   41:  * @author Ryan Parman
   42:  * @author Geoffrey Sneddon
   43:  * @author Ryan McCue
   44:  * @link http://simplepie.org/ SimplePie
   45:  * @license http://www.opensource.org/licenses/bsd-license.php BSD License
   46:  */
   47: 
   48: /**
   49:  * SimplePie class.
   50:  *
   51:  * Class for backward compatibility.
   52:  *
   53:  * @package SimplePie
   54:  */
   55: class SimplePie extends SimplePie_Core
   56: {
   57: 
   58: }
   59: 
   60: /**
   61:  * Manages all author-related data
   62:  *
   63:  * Used by {@see SimplePie_Item::get_author()} and {@see SimplePie::get_authors()}
   64:  *
   65:  * This class can be overloaded with {@see SimplePie::set_author_class()}
   66:  *
   67:  * @package SimplePie
   68:  */
   69: class SimplePie_Author
   70: {
   71:     /**
   72:      * Author's name
   73:      *
   74:      * @var string
   75:      * @see get_name()
   76:      */
   77:     var $name;
   78: 
   79:     /**
   80:      * Author's link
   81:      *
   82:      * @var string
   83:      * @see get_link()
   84:      */
   85:     var $link;
   86: 
   87:     /**
   88:      * Author's email address
   89:      *
   90:      * @var string
   91:      * @see get_email()
   92:      */
   93:     var $email;
   94: 
   95:     /**
   96:      * Constructor, used to input the data
   97:      *
   98:      * @param string $name
   99:      * @param string $link
  100:      * @param string $email
  101:      */
  102:     public function __construct($name = null, $link = null, $email = null)
  103:     {
  104:         $this->name = $name;
  105:         $this->link = $link;
  106:         $this->email = $email;
  107:     }
  108: 
  109:     /**
  110:      * String-ified version
  111:      *
  112:      * @return string
  113:      */
  114:     public function __toString()
  115:     {
  116:         // There is no $this->data here
  117:         return md5(serialize($this));
  118:     }
  119: 
  120:     /**
  121:      * Author's name
  122:      *
  123:      * @return string|null
  124:      */
  125:     public function get_name()
  126:     {
  127:         if ($this->name !== null)
  128:         {
  129:             return $this->name;
  130:         }
  131:         else
  132:         {
  133:             return null;
  134:         }
  135:     }
  136: 
  137:     /**
  138:      * Author's link
  139:      *
  140:      * @return string|null
  141:      */
  142:     public function get_link()
  143:     {
  144:         if ($this->link !== null)
  145:         {
  146:             return $this->link;
  147:         }
  148:         else
  149:         {
  150:             return null;
  151:         }
  152:     }
  153: 
  154:     /**
  155:      * Author's email address
  156:      *
  157:      * @return string|null
  158:      */
  159:     public function get_email()
  160:     {
  161:         if ($this->email !== null)
  162:         {
  163:             return $this->email;
  164:         }
  165:         else
  166:         {
  167:             return null;
  168:         }
  169:     }
  170: }
  171: 
  172: /**
  173:  * Base for cache objects
  174:  *
  175:  * Classes to be used with {@see SimplePie_Cache::register()} are expected
  176:  * to implement this interface.
  177:  *
  178:  * @package SimplePie
  179:  */
  180: interface SimplePie_Cache_Base
  181: {
  182:     /**
  183:      * Feed cache type
  184:      *
  185:      * @var string
  186:      */
  187:     const TYPE_FEED = 'spc';
  188: 
  189:     /**
  190:      * Image cache type
  191:      *
  192:      * @var string
  193:      */
  194:     const TYPE_IMAGE = 'spi';
  195: 
  196:     /**
  197:      * Create a new cache object
  198:      *
  199:      * @param string $location Location string (from SimplePie::$cache_location)
  200:      * @param string $name Unique ID for the cache
  201:      * @param string $type Either TYPE_FEED for SimplePie data, or TYPE_IMAGE for image data
  202:      */
  203:     public function __construct($location, $name, $type);
  204: 
  205:     /**
  206:      * Save data to the cache
  207:      *
  208:      * @param array|SimplePie $data Data to store in the cache. If passed a SimplePie object, only cache the $data property
  209:      * @return bool Successfulness
  210:      */
  211:     public function save($data);
  212: 
  213:     /**
  214:      * Retrieve the data saved to the cache
  215:      *
  216:      * @return array Data for SimplePie::$data
  217:      */
  218:     public function load();
  219: 
  220:     /**
  221:      * Retrieve the last modified time for the cache
  222:      *
  223:      * @return int Timestamp
  224:      */
  225:     public function mtime();
  226: 
  227:     /**
  228:      * Set the last modified time to the current time
  229:      *
  230:      * @return bool Success status
  231:      */
  232:     public function touch();
  233: 
  234:     /**
  235:      * Remove the cache
  236:      *
  237:      * @return bool Success status
  238:      */
  239:     public function unlink();
  240: }
  241: 
  242: /**
  243:  * Base class for database-based caches
  244:  *
  245:  * @package SimplePie
  246:  */
  247: abstract class SimplePie_Cache_DB implements SimplePie_Cache_Base
  248: {
  249:     /**
  250:      * Helper for database conversion
  251:      *
  252:      * Converts a given {@see SimplePie} object into data to be stored
  253:      *
  254:      * @param SimplePie $data
  255:      * @return array First item is the serialized data for storage, second item is the unique ID for this item
  256:      */
  257:     protected static function prepare_simplepie_object_for_cache(&$data)
  258:     {
  259:         $items = $data->get_items();
  260:         $items_by_id = array();
  261: 
  262:         if (!empty($items))
  263:         {
  264:             foreach ($items as $item)
  265:             {
  266:                 $items_by_id[$item->get_id()] = $item;
  267:             }
  268: 
  269:             if (count($items_by_id) !== count($items))
  270:             {
  271:                 $items_by_id = array();
  272:                 foreach ($items as $item)
  273:                 {
  274:                     $items_by_id[$item->get_id(true)] = $item;
  275:                 }
  276:             }
  277: 
  278:             if (isset($data->data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_10]['feed'][0]))
  279:             {
  280:                 $channel =& $data->data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_10]['feed'][0];
  281:             }
  282:             elseif (isset($data->data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_03]['feed'][0]))
  283:             {
  284:                 $channel =& $data->data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_03]['feed'][0];
  285:             }
  286:             elseif (isset($data->data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RDF]['RDF'][0]))
  287:             {
  288:                 $channel =& $data->data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RDF]['RDF'][0];
  289:             }
  290:             elseif (isset($data->data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_20]['rss'][0]['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_20]['channel'][0]))
  291:             {
  292:                 $channel =& $data->data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_20]['rss'][0]['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_20]['channel'][0];
  293:             }
  294:             else
  295:             {
  296:                 $channel = null;
  297:             }
  298: 
  299:             if ($channel !== null)
  300:             {
  301:                 if (isset($channel['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_10]['entry']))
  302:                 {
  303:                     unset($channel['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_10]['entry']);
  304:                 }
  305:                 if (isset($channel['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_03]['entry']))
  306:                 {
  307:                     unset($channel['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_03]['entry']);
  308:                 }
  309:                 if (isset($channel['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_10]['item']))
  310:                 {
  311:                     unset($channel['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_10]['item']);
  312:                 }
  313:                 if (isset($channel['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_090]['item']))
  314:                 {
  315:                     unset($channel['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_090]['item']);
  316:                 }
  317:                 if (isset($channel['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_20]['item']))
  318:                 {
  319:                     unset($channel['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_20]['item']);
  320:                 }
  321:             }
  322:             if (isset($data->data['items']))
  323:             {
  324:                 unset($data->data['items']);
  325:             }
  326:             if (isset($data->data['ordered_items']))
  327:             {
  328:                 unset($data->data['ordered_items']);
  329:             }
  330:         }
  331:         return array(serialize($data->data), $items_by_id);
  332:     }
  333: }
  334: 
  335: /**
  336:  * Caches data to the filesystem
  337:  *
  338:  * @package SimplePie
  339:  */
  340: class SimplePie_Cache_File implements SimplePie_Cache_Base
  341: {
  342:     /**
  343:      * Location string
  344:      *
  345:      * @see SimplePie::$cache_location
  346:      * @var string
  347:      */
  348:     protected $location;
  349: 
  350:     /**
  351:      * Filename
  352:      *
  353:      * @var string
  354:      */
  355:     protected $filename;
  356: 
  357:     /**
  358:      * File extension
  359:      *
  360:      * @var string
  361:      */
  362:     protected $extension;
  363: 
  364:     /**
  365:      * File path
  366:      *
  367:      * @var string
  368:      */
  369:     protected $name;
  370: 
  371:     /**
  372:      * Create a new cache object
  373:      *
  374:      * @param string $location Location string (from SimplePie::$cache_location)
  375:      * @param string $name Unique ID for the cache
  376:      * @param string $type Either TYPE_FEED for SimplePie data, or TYPE_IMAGE for image data
  377:      */
  378:     public function __construct($location, $name, $type)
  379:     {
  380:         $this->location = $location;
  381:         $this->filename = $name;
  382:         $this->extension = $type;
  383:         $this->name = "$this->location/$this->filename.$this->extension";
  384:     }
  385: 
  386:     /**
  387:      * Save data to the cache
  388:      *
  389:      * @param array|SimplePie $data Data to store in the cache. If passed a SimplePie object, only cache the $data property
  390:      * @return bool Successfulness
  391:      */
  392:     public function save($data)
  393:     {
  394:         if (file_exists($this->name) && is_writeable($this->name) || file_exists($this->location) && is_writeable($this->location))
  395:         {
  396:             if ($data instanceof SimplePie)
  397:             {
  398:                 $data = $data->data;
  399:             }
  400: 
  401:             $data = serialize($data);
  402:             return (bool) file_put_contents($this->name, $data);
  403:         }
  404:         return false;
  405:     }
  406: 
  407:     /**
  408:      * Retrieve the data saved to the cache
  409:      *
  410:      * @return array Data for SimplePie::$data
  411:      */
  412:     public function load()
  413:     {
  414:         if (file_exists($this->name) && is_readable($this->name))
  415:         {
  416:             return unserialize(file_get_contents($this->name));
  417:         }
  418:         return false;
  419:     }
  420: 
  421:     /**
  422:      * Retrieve the last modified time for the cache
  423:      *
  424:      * @return int Timestamp
  425:      */
  426:     public function mtime()
  427:     {
  428:         if (file_exists($this->name))
  429:         {
  430:             return filemtime($this->name);
  431:         }
  432:         return false;
  433:     }
  434: 
  435:     /**
  436:      * Set the last modified time to the current time
  437:      *
  438:      * @return bool Success status
  439:      */
  440:     public function touch()
  441:     {
  442:         if (file_exists($this->name))
  443:         {
  444:             return touch($this->name);
  445:         }
  446:         return false;
  447:     }
  448: 
  449:     /**
  450:      * Remove the cache
  451:      *
  452:      * @return bool Success status
  453:      */
  454:     public function unlink()
  455:     {
  456:         if (file_exists($this->name))
  457:         {
  458:             return unlink($this->name);
  459:         }
  460:         return false;
  461:     }
  462: }
  463: 
  464: /**
  465:  * Caches data to memcache
  466:  *
  467:  * Registered for URLs with the "memcache" protocol
  468:  *
  469:  * For example, `memcache://localhost:11211/?timeout=3600^prefix=sp_` will
  470:  * connect to memcache on `localhost` on port 11211. All tables will be
  471:  * prefixed with `sp_` and data will expire after 3600 seconds
  472:  *
  473:  * @package SimplePie
  474:  * @uses Memcache
  475:  */
  476: class SimplePie_Cache_Memcache implements SimplePie_Cache_Base
  477: {
  478:     /**
  479:      * Memcache instance
  480:      *
  481:      * @var Memcache
  482:      */
  483:     protected $cache;
  484: 
  485:     /**
  486:      * Options
  487:      *
  488:      * @var array
  489:      */
  490:     protected $options;
  491: 
  492:     /**
  493:      * Cache name
  494:      *
  495:      * @var string
  496:      */
  497:     protected $name;
  498: 
  499:     /**
  500:      * Create a new cache object
  501:      *
  502:      * @param string $location Location string (from SimplePie::$cache_location)
  503:      * @param string $name Unique ID for the cache
  504:      * @param string $type Either TYPE_FEED for SimplePie data, or TYPE_IMAGE for image data
  505:      */
  506:     public function __construct($location, $name, $type)
  507:     {
  508:         $this->options = array(
  509:             'host' => '127.0.0.1',
  510:             'port' => 11211,
  511:             'extras' => array(
  512:                 'timeout' => 3600, // one hour
  513:                 'prefix' => 'simplepie_',
  514:             ),
  515:         );
  516:         $this->options = array_merge_recursive($this->options, SimplePie_Cache::parse_URL($location));
  517:         $this->name = $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . md5("$name:$type");
  518: 
  519:         $this->cache = new Memcache();
  520:         $this->cache->addServer($this->options['host'], (int) $this->options['port']);
  521:     }
  522: 
  523:     /**
  524:      * Save data to the cache
  525:      *
  526:      * @param array|SimplePie $data Data to store in the cache. If passed a SimplePie object, only cache the $data property
  527:      * @return bool Successfulness
  528:      */
  529:     public function save($data)
  530:     {
  531:         if ($data instanceof SimplePie)
  532:         {
  533:             $data = $data->data;
  534:         }
  535:         return $this->cache->set($this->name, serialize($data), MEMCACHE_COMPRESSED, (int) $this->options['extras']['timeout']);
  536:     }
  537: 
  538:     /**
  539:      * Retrieve the data saved to the cache
  540:      *
  541:      * @return array Data for SimplePie::$data
  542:      */
  543:     public function load()
  544:     {
  545:         $data = $this->cache->get($this->name);
  546: 
  547:         if ($data !== false)
  548:         {
  549:             return unserialize($data);
  550:         }
  551:         return false;
  552:     }
  553: 
  554:     /**
  555:      * Retrieve the last modified time for the cache
  556:      *
  557:      * @return int Timestamp
  558:      */
  559:     public function mtime()
  560:     {
  561:         $data = $this->cache->get($this->name);
  562: 
  563:         if ($data !== false)
  564:         {
  565:             // essentially ignore the mtime because Memcache expires on it's own
  566:             return time();
  567:         }
  568: 
  569:         return false;
  570:     }
  571: 
  572:     /**
  573:      * Set the last modified time to the current time
  574:      *
  575:      * @return bool Success status
  576:      */
  577:     public function touch()
  578:     {
  579:         $data = $this->cache->get($this->name);
  580: 
  581:         if ($data !== false)
  582:         {
  583:             return $this->cache->set($this->name, $data, MEMCACHE_COMPRESSED, (int) $this->duration);
  584:         }
  585: 
  586:         return false;
  587:     }
  588: 
  589:     /**
  590:      * Remove the cache
  591:      *
  592:      * @return bool Success status
  593:      */
  594:     public function unlink()
  595:     {
  596:         return $this->cache->delete($this->name, 0);
  597:     }
  598: }
  599: 
  600: /**
  601:  * Caches data to a MySQL database
  602:  *
  603:  * Registered for URLs with the "mysql" protocol
  604:  *
  605:  * For example, `mysql://root:password@localhost:3306/mydb?prefix=sp_` will
  606:  * connect to the `mydb` database on `localhost` on port 3306, with the user
  607:  * `root` and the password `password`. All tables will be prefixed with `sp_`
  608:  *
  609:  * @package SimplePie
  610:  */
  611: class SimplePie_Cache_MySQL extends SimplePie_Cache_DB
  612: {
  613:     /**
  614:      * PDO instance
  615:      *
  616:      * @var PDO
  617:      */
  618:     protected $mysql;
  619: 
  620:     /**
  621:      * Options
  622:      *
  623:      * @var array
  624:      */
  625:     protected $options;
  626: 
  627:     /**
  628:      * Cache ID
  629:      *
  630:      * @var string
  631:      */
  632:     protected $id;
  633: 
  634:     /**
  635:      * Create a new cache object
  636:      *
  637:      * @param string $location Location string (from SimplePie::$cache_location)
  638:      * @param string $name Unique ID for the cache
  639:      * @param string $type Either TYPE_FEED for SimplePie data, or TYPE_IMAGE for image data
  640:      */
  641:     public function __construct($location, $name, $type)
  642:     {
  643:         $this->options = array(
  644:             'user' => null,
  645:             'pass' => null,
  646:             'host' => '127.0.0.1',
  647:             'port' => '3306',
  648:             'path' => '',
  649:             'extras' => array(
  650:                 'prefix' => '',
  651:             ),
  652:         );
  653:         $this->options = array_merge_recursive($this->options, SimplePie_Cache::parse_URL($location));
  654: 
  655:         // Path is prefixed with a "/"
  656:         $this->options['dbname'] = substr($this->options['path'], 1);
  657: 
  658:         try
  659:         {
  660:             $this->mysql = new PDO("mysql:dbname={$this->options['dbname']};host={$this->options['host']};port={$this->options['port']}", $this->options['user'], $this->options['pass'], array(PDO::MYSQL_ATTR_INIT_COMMAND => 'SET NAMES utf8'));
  661:         }
  662:         catch (PDOException $e)
  663:         {
  664:             $this->mysql = null;
  665:             return;
  666:         }
  667: 
  668:         $this->id = $name . $type;
  669: 
  670:         if (!$query = $this->mysql->query('SHOW TABLES'))
  671:         {
  672:             $this->mysql = null;
  673:             return;
  674:         }
  675: 
  676:         $db = array();
  677:         while ($row = $query->fetchColumn())
  678:         {
  679:             $db[] = $row;
  680:         }
  681: 
  682:         if (!in_array($this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'cache_data', $db))
  683:         {
  684:             $query = $this->mysql->exec('CREATE TABLE `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'cache_data` (`id` TEXT CHARACTER SET utf8 NOT NULL, `items` SMALLINT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0, `data` BLOB NOT NULL, `mtime` INT UNSIGNED NOT NULL, UNIQUE (`id`(125)))');
  685:             if ($query === false)
  686:             {
  687:                 $this->mysql = null;
  688:             }
  689:         }
  690: 
  691:         if (!in_array($this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'items', $db))
  692:         {
  693:             $query = $this->mysql->exec('CREATE TABLE `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'items` (`feed_id` TEXT CHARACTER SET utf8 NOT NULL, `id` TEXT CHARACTER SET utf8 NOT NULL, `data` TEXT CHARACTER SET utf8 NOT NULL, `posted` INT UNSIGNED NOT NULL, INDEX `feed_id` (`feed_id`(125)))');
  694:             if ($query === false)
  695:             {
  696:                 $this->mysql = null;
  697:             }
  698:         }
  699:     }
  700: 
  701:     /**
  702:      * Save data to the cache
  703:      *
  704:      * @param array|SimplePie $data Data to store in the cache. If passed a SimplePie object, only cache the $data property
  705:      * @return bool Successfulness
  706:      */
  707:     public function save($data)
  708:     {
  709:         if ($this->mysql === null)
  710:         {
  711:             return false;
  712:         }
  713: 
  714:         if ($data instanceof SimplePie)
  715:         {
  716:             $data = clone $data;
  717: 
  718:             $prepared = self::prepare_simplepie_object_for_cache($data);
  719: 
  720:             $query = $this->mysql->prepare('SELECT COUNT(*) FROM `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'cache_data` WHERE `id` = :feed');
  721:             $query->bindValue(':feed', $this->id);
  722:             if ($query->execute())
  723:             {
  724:                 if ($query->fetchColumn() > 0)
  725:                 {
  726:                     $items = count($prepared[1]);
  727:                     if ($items)
  728:                     {
  729:                         $sql = 'UPDATE `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'cache_data` SET `items` = :items, `data` = :data, `mtime` = :time WHERE `id` = :feed';
  730:                         $query = $this->mysql->prepare($sql);
  731:                         $query->bindValue(':items', $items);
  732:                     }
  733:                     else
  734:                     {
  735:                         $sql = 'UPDATE `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'cache_data` SET `data` = :data, `mtime` = :time WHERE `id` = :feed';
  736:                         $query = $this->mysql->prepare($sql);
  737:                     }
  738: 
  739:                     $query->bindValue(':data', $prepared[0]);
  740:                     $query->bindValue(':time', time());
  741:                     $query->bindValue(':feed', $this->id);
  742:                     if (!$query->execute())
  743:                     {
  744:                         return false;
  745:                     }
  746:                 }
  747:                 else
  748:                 {
  749:                     $query = $this->mysql->prepare('INSERT INTO `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'cache_data` (`id`, `items`, `data`, `mtime`) VALUES(:feed, :count, :data, :time)');
  750:                     $query->bindValue(':feed', $this->id);
  751:                     $query->bindValue(':count', count($prepared[1]));
  752:                     $query->bindValue(':data', $prepared[0]);
  753:                     $query->bindValue(':time', time());
  754:                     if (!$query->execute())
  755:                     {
  756:                         return false;
  757:                     }
  758:                 }
  759: 
  760:                 $ids = array_keys($prepared[1]);
  761:                 if (!empty($ids))
  762:                 {
  763:                     foreach ($ids as $id)
  764:                     {
  765:                         $database_ids[] = $this->mysql->quote($id);
  766:                     }
  767: 
  768:                     $query = $this->mysql->prepare('SELECT `id` FROM `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'items` WHERE `id` = ' . implode(' OR `id` = ', $database_ids) . ' AND `feed_id` = :feed');
  769:                     $query->bindValue(':feed', $this->id);
  770: 
  771:                     if ($query->execute())
  772:                     {
  773:                         $existing_ids = array();
  774:                         while ($row = $query->fetchColumn())
  775:                         {
  776:                             $existing_ids[] = $row;
  777:                         }
  778: 
  779:                         $new_ids = array_diff($ids, $existing_ids);
  780: 
  781:                         foreach ($new_ids as $new_id)
  782:                         {
  783:                             if (!($date = $prepared[1][$new_id]->get_date('U')))
  784:                             {
  785:                                 $date = time();
  786:                             }
  787: 
  788:                             $query = $this->mysql->prepare('INSERT INTO `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'items` (`feed_id`, `id`, `data`, `posted`) VALUES(:feed, :id, :data, :date)');
  789:                             $query->bindValue(':feed', $this->id);
  790:                             $query->bindValue(':id', $new_id);
  791:                             $query->bindValue(':data', serialize($prepared[1][$new_id]->data));
  792:                             $query->bindValue(':date', $date);
  793:                             if (!$query->execute())
  794:                             {
  795:                                 return false;
  796:                             }
  797:                         }
  798:                         return true;
  799:                     }
  800:                 }
  801:                 else
  802:                 {
  803:                     return true;
  804:                 }
  805:             }
  806:         }
  807:         else
  808:         {
  809:             $query = $this->mysql->prepare('SELECT `id` FROM `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'cache_data` WHERE `id` = :feed');
  810:             $query->bindValue(':feed', $this->id);
  811:             if ($query->execute())
  812:             {
  813:                 if ($query->rowCount() > 0)
  814:                 {
  815:                     $query = $this->mysql->prepare('UPDATE `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'cache_data` SET `items` = 0, `data` = :data, `mtime` = :time WHERE `id` = :feed');
  816:                     $query->bindValue(':data', serialize($data));
  817:                     $query->bindValue(':time', time());
  818:                     $query->bindValue(':feed', $this->id);
  819:                     if ($this->execute())
  820:                     {
  821:                         return true;
  822:                     }
  823:                 }
  824:                 else
  825:                 {
  826:                     $query = $this->mysql->prepare('INSERT INTO `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'cache_data` (`id`, `items`, `data`, `mtime`) VALUES(:id, 0, :data, :time)');
  827:                     $query->bindValue(':id', $this->id);
  828:                     $query->bindValue(':data', serialize($data));
  829:                     $query->bindValue(':time', time());
  830:                     if ($query->execute())
  831:                     {
  832:                         return true;
  833:                     }
  834:                 }
  835:             }
  836:         }
  837:         return false;
  838:     }
  839: 
  840:     /**
  841:      * Retrieve the data saved to the cache
  842:      *
  843:      * @return array Data for SimplePie::$data
  844:      */
  845:     public function load()
  846:     {
  847:         if ($this->mysql === null)
  848:         {
  849:             return false;
  850:         }
  851: 
  852:         $query = $this->mysql->prepare('SELECT `items`, `data` FROM `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'cache_data` WHERE `id` = :id');
  853:         $query->bindValue(':id', $this->id);
  854:         if ($query->execute() && ($row = $query->fetch()))
  855:         {
  856:             $data = unserialize($row[1]);
  857: 
  858:             if (isset($this->options['items'][0]))
  859:             {
  860:                 $items = (int) $this->options['items'][0];
  861:             }
  862:             else
  863:             {
  864:                 $items = (int) $row[0];
  865:             }
  866: 
  867:             if ($items !== 0)
  868:             {
  869:                 if (isset($data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_10]['feed'][0]))
  870:                 {
  871:                     $feed =& $data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_10]['feed'][0];
  872:                 }
  873:                 elseif (isset($data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_03]['feed'][0]))
  874:                 {
  875:                     $feed =& $data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_03]['feed'][0];
  876:                 }
  877:                 elseif (isset($data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RDF]['RDF'][0]))
  878:                 {
  879:                     $feed =& $data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RDF]['RDF'][0];
  880:                 }
  881:                 elseif (isset($data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_20]['rss'][0]))
  882:                 {
  883:                     $feed =& $data['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_20]['rss'][0];
  884:                 }
  885:                 else
  886:                 {
  887:                     $feed = null;
  888:                 }
  889: 
  890:                 if ($feed !== null)
  891:                 {
  892:                     $sql = 'SELECT `data` FROM `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'items` WHERE `feed_id` = :feed ORDER BY `posted` DESC';
  893:                     if ($items > 0)
  894:                     {
  895:                         $sql .= ' LIMIT ' . $items;
  896:                     }
  897: 
  898:                     $query = $this->mysql->prepare($sql);
  899:                     $query->bindValue(':feed', $this->id);
  900:                     if ($query->execute())
  901:                     {
  902:                         while ($row = $query->fetchColumn())
  903:                         {
  904:                             $feed['child'][SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_10]['entry'][] = unserialize($row);
  905:                         }
  906:                     }
  907:                     else
  908:                     {
  909:                         return false;
  910:                     }
  911:                 }
  912:             }
  913:             return $data;
  914:         }
  915:         return false;
  916:     }
  917: 
  918:     /**
  919:      * Retrieve the last modified time for the cache
  920:      *
  921:      * @return int Timestamp
  922:      */
  923:     public function mtime()
  924:     {
  925:         if ($this->mysql === null)
  926:         {
  927:             return false;
  928:         }
  929: 
  930:         $query = $this->mysql->prepare('SELECT `mtime` FROM `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'cache_data` WHERE `id` = :id');
  931:         $query->bindValue(':id', $this->id);
  932:         if ($query->execute() && ($time = $query->fetchColumn()))
  933:         {
  934:             return $time;
  935:         }
  936:         else
  937:         {
  938:             return false;
  939:         }
  940:     }
  941: 
  942:     /**
  943:      * Set the last modified time to the current time
  944:      *
  945:      * @return bool Success status
  946:      */
  947:     public function touch()
  948:     {
  949:         if ($this->mysql === null)
  950:         {
  951:             return false;
  952:         }
  953: 
  954:         $query = $this->mysql->prepare('UPDATE `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'cache_data` SET `mtime` = :time WHERE `id` = :id');
  955:         $query->bindValue(':time', time());
  956:         $query->bindValue(':id', $this->id);
  957:         if ($query->execute() && $query->rowCount() > 0)
  958:         {
  959:             return true;
  960:         }
  961:         else
  962:         {
  963:             return false;
  964:         }
  965:     }
  966: 
  967:     /**
  968:      * Remove the cache
  969:      *
  970:      * @return bool Success status
  971:      */
  972:     public function unlink()
  973:     {
  974:         if ($this->mysql === null)
  975:         {
  976:             return false;
  977:         }
  978: 
  979:         $query = $this->mysql->prepare('DELETE FROM `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'cache_data` WHERE `id` = :id');
  980:         $query->bindValue(':id', $this->id);
  981:         $query2 = $this->mysql->prepare('DELETE FROM `' . $this->options['extras']['prefix'] . 'items` WHERE `feed_id` = :id');
  982:         $query2->bindValue(':id', $this->id);
  983:         if ($query->execute() && $query2->execute())
  984:         {
  985:             return true;
  986:         }
  987:         else
  988:         {
  989:             return false;
  990:         }
  991:     }
  992: }
  993: 
  994: /**
  995:  * Used to create cache objects
  996:  *
  997:  * This class can be overloaded with {@see SimplePie::set_cache_class()},
  998:  * although the preferred way is to create your own handler
  999:  * via {@see register()}
 1000:  *
 1001:  * @package SimplePie
 1002:  */
 1003: class SimplePie_Cache
 1004: {
 1005:     /**
 1006:      * Cache handler classes
 1007:      *
 1008:      * These receive 3 parameters to their constructor, as documented in
 1009:      * {@see register()}
 1010:      * @var array
 1011:      */
 1012:     protected static $handlers = array(
 1013:         'mysql' => 'SimplePie_Cache_MySQL',
 1014:         'memcache' => 'SimplePie_Cache_Memcache',
 1015:     );
 1016: 
 1017:     /**
 1018:      * Don't call the constructor. Please.
 1019:      */
 1020:     private function __construct() { }
 1021: 
 1022:     /**
 1023:      * Create a new SimplePie_Cache object
 1024:      *
 1025:      * @param string $location URL location (scheme is used to determine handler)
 1026:      * @param string $filename Unique identifier for cache object
 1027:      * @param string $extension 'spi' or 'spc'
 1028:      * @return SimplePie_Cache_Base Type of object depends on scheme of `$location`
 1029:      */
 1030:     public static function create($location, $filename, $extension)
 1031:     {
 1032:         $type = explode(':', $location, 2);
 1033:         $type = $type[0];
 1034:         if (!empty(self::$handlers[$type]))
 1035:         {
 1036:             $class = self::$handlers[$type];
 1037:             return new $class($location, $filename, $extension);
 1038:         }
 1039: 
 1040:         return new SimplePie_Cache_File($location, $filename, $extension);
 1041:     }
 1042: 
 1043:     /**
 1044:      * Register a handler
 1045:      *
 1046:      * @param string $type DSN type to register for
 1047:      * @param string $class Name of handler class. Must implement SimplePie_Cache_Base
 1048:      */
 1049:     public static function register($type, $class)
 1050:     {
 1051:         self::$handlers[$type] = $class;
 1052:     }
 1053: 
 1054:     /**
 1055:      * Parse a URL into an array
 1056:      *
 1057:      * @param string $url
 1058:      * @return array
 1059:      */
 1060:     public static function parse_URL($url)
 1061:     {
 1062:         $params = parse_url($url);
 1063:         $params['extras'] = array();
 1064:         if (isset($params['query']))
 1065:         {
 1066:             parse_str($params['query'], $params['extras']);
 1067:         }
 1068:         return $params;
 1069:     }
 1070: }
 1071: 
 1072: /**
 1073:  * Handles `<media:text>` captions as defined in Media RSS.
 1074:  *
 1075:  * Used by {@see SimplePie_Enclosure::get_caption()} and {@see SimplePie_Enclosure::get_captions()}
 1076:  *
 1077:  * This class can be overloaded with {@see SimplePie::set_caption_class()}
 1078:  *
 1079:  * @package SimplePie
 1080:  */
 1081: class SimplePie_Caption
 1082: {
 1083:     /**
 1084:      * Content type
 1085:      *
 1086:      * @var string
 1087:      * @see get_type()
 1088:      */
 1089:     var $type;
 1090: 
 1091:     /**
 1092:      * Language
 1093:      *
 1094:      * @var string
 1095:      * @see get_language()
 1096:      */
 1097:     var $lang;
 1098: 
 1099:     /**
 1100:      * Start time
 1101:      *
 1102:      * @var string
 1103:      * @see get_starttime()
 1104:      */
 1105:     var $startTime;
 1106: 
 1107:     /**
 1108:      * End time
 1109:      *
 1110:      * @var string
 1111:      * @see get_endtime()
 1112:      */
 1113:     var $endTime;
 1114: 
 1115:     /**
 1116:      * Caption text
 1117:      *
 1118:      * @var string
 1119:      * @see get_text()
 1120:      */
 1121:     var $text;
 1122: 
 1123:     /**
 1124:      * Constructor, used to input the data
 1125:      *
 1126:      * For documentation on all the parameters, see the corresponding
 1127:      * properties and their accessors
 1128:      */
 1129:     public function __construct($type = null, $lang = null, $startTime = null, $endTime = null, $text = null)
 1130:     {
 1131:         $this->type = $type;
 1132:         $this->lang = $lang;
 1133:         $this->startTime = $startTime;
 1134:         $this->endTime = $endTime;
 1135:         $this->text = $text;
 1136:     }
 1137: 
 1138:     /**
 1139:      * String-ified version
 1140:      *
 1141:      * @return string
 1142:      */
 1143:     public function __toString()
 1144:     {
 1145:         // There is no $this->data here
 1146:         return md5(serialize($this));
 1147:     }
 1148: 
 1149:     /**
 1150:      * Get the end time
 1151:      *
 1152:      * @return string|null Time in the format 'hh:mm:ss.SSS'
 1153:      */
 1154:     public function get_endtime()
 1155:     {
 1156:         if ($this->endTime !== null)
 1157:         {
 1158:             return $this->endTime;
 1159:         }
 1160:         else
 1161:         {
 1162:             return null;
 1163:         }
 1164:     }
 1165: 
 1166:     /**
 1167:      * Get the language
 1168:      *
 1169:      * @link http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3066
 1170:      * @return string|null Language code as per RFC 3066
 1171:      */
 1172:     public function get_language()
 1173:     {
 1174:         if ($this->lang !== null)
 1175:         {
 1176:             return $this->lang;
 1177:         }
 1178:         else
 1179:         {
 1180:             return null;
 1181:         }
 1182:     }
 1183: 
 1184:     /**
 1185:      * Get the start time
 1186:      *
 1187:      * @return string|null Time in the format 'hh:mm:ss.SSS'
 1188:      */
 1189:     public function get_starttime()
 1190:     {
 1191:         if ($this->startTime !== null)
 1192:         {
 1193:             return $this->startTime;
 1194:         }
 1195:         else
 1196:         {
 1197:             return null;
 1198:         }
 1199:     }
 1200: 
 1201:     /**
 1202:      * Get the text of the caption
 1203:      *
 1204:      * @return string|null
 1205:      */
 1206:     public function get_text()
 1207:     {
 1208:         if ($this->text !== null)
 1209:         {
 1210:             return $this->text;
 1211:         }
 1212:         else
 1213:         {
 1214:             return null;
 1215:         }
 1216:     }
 1217: 
 1218:     /**
 1219:      * Get the content type (not MIME type)
 1220:      *
 1221:      * @return string|null Either 'text' or 'html'
 1222:      */
 1223:     public function get_type()
 1224:     {
 1225:         if ($this->type !== null)
 1226:         {
 1227:             return $this->type;
 1228:         }
 1229:         else
 1230:         {
 1231:             return null;
 1232:         }
 1233:     }
 1234: }
 1235: 
 1236: /**
 1237:  * Manages all category-related data
 1238:  *
 1239:  * Used by {@see SimplePie_Item::get_category()} and {@see SimplePie_Item::get_categories()}
 1240:  *
 1241:  * This class can be overloaded with {@see SimplePie::set_category_class()}
 1242:  *
 1243:  * @package SimplePie
 1244:  */
 1245: class SimplePie_Category
 1246: {
 1247:     /**
 1248:      * Category identifier
 1249:      *
 1250:      * @var string
 1251:      * @see get_term
 1252:      */
 1253:     var $term;
 1254: 
 1255:     /**
 1256:      * Categorization scheme identifier
 1257:      *
 1258:      * @var string
 1259:      * @see get_scheme()
 1260:      */
 1261:     var $scheme;
 1262: 
 1263:     /**
 1264:      * Human readable label
 1265:      *
 1266:      * @var string
 1267:      * @see get_label()
 1268:      */
 1269:     var $label;
 1270: 
 1271:     /**
 1272:      * Constructor, used to input the data
 1273:      *
 1274:      * @param string $term
 1275:      * @param string $scheme
 1276:      * @param string $label
 1277:      */
 1278:     public function __construct($term = null, $scheme = null, $label = null)
 1279:     {
 1280:         $this->term = $term;
 1281:         $this->scheme = $scheme;
 1282:         $this->label = $label;
 1283:     }
 1284: 
 1285:     /**
 1286:      * String-ified version
 1287:      *
 1288:      * @return string
 1289:      */
 1290:     public function __toString()
 1291:     {
 1292:         // There is no $this->data here
 1293:         return md5(serialize($this));
 1294:     }
 1295: 
 1296:     /**
 1297:      * Get the category identifier
 1298:      *
 1299:      * @return string|null
 1300:      */
 1301:     public function get_term()
 1302:     {
 1303:         if ($this->term !== null)
 1304:         {
 1305:             return $this->term;
 1306:         }
 1307:         else
 1308:         {
 1309:             return null;
 1310:         }
 1311:     }
 1312: 
 1313:     /**
 1314:      * Get the categorization scheme identifier
 1315:      *
 1316:      * @return string|null
 1317:      */
 1318:     public function get_scheme()
 1319:     {
 1320:         if ($this->scheme !== null)
 1321:         {
 1322:             return $this->scheme;
 1323:         }
 1324:         else
 1325:         {
 1326:             return null;
 1327:         }
 1328:     }
 1329: 
 1330:     /**
 1331:      * Get the human readable label
 1332:      *
 1333:      * @return string|null
 1334:      */
 1335:     public function get_label()
 1336:     {
 1337:         if ($this->label !== null)
 1338:         {
 1339:             return $this->label;
 1340:         }
 1341:         else
 1342:         {
 1343:             return $this->get_term();
 1344:         }
 1345:     }
 1346: }
 1347: 
 1348: /**
 1349:  * Content-type sniffing
 1350:  *
 1351:  * Based on the rules in http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-abarth-mime-sniff-06
 1352:  *
 1353:  * This is used since we can't always trust Content-Type headers, and is based
 1354:  * upon the HTML5 parsing rules.
 1355:  *
 1356:  *
 1357:  * This class can be overloaded with {@see SimplePie::set_content_type_sniffer_class()}
 1358:  *
 1359:  * @package SimplePie
 1360:  */
 1361: class SimplePie_Content_Type_Sniffer
 1362: {
 1363:     /**
 1364:      * File object
 1365:      *
 1366:      * @var SimplePie_File
 1367:      */
 1368:     var $file;
 1369: 
 1370:     /**
 1371:      * Create an instance of the class with the input file
 1372:      *
 1373:      * @param SimplePie_Content_Type_Sniffer $file Input file
 1374:      */
 1375:     public function __construct($file)
 1376:     {
 1377:         $this->file = $file;
 1378:     }
 1379: 
 1380:     /**
 1381:      * Get the Content-Type of the specified file
 1382:      *
 1383:      * @return string Actual Content-Type
 1384:      */
 1385:     public function get_type()
 1386:     {
 1387:         if (isset($this->file->headers['content-type']))
 1388:         {
 1389:             if (!isset($this->file->headers['content-encoding'])
 1390:                 && ($this->file->headers['content-type'] === 'text/plain'
 1391:                     || $this->file->headers['content-type'] === 'text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1'
 1392:                     || $this->file->headers['content-type'] === 'text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1'
 1393:                     || $this->file->headers['content-type'] === 'text/plain; charset=UTF-8'))
 1394:             {
 1395:                 return $this->text_or_binary();
 1396:             }
 1397: 
 1398:             if (($pos = strpos($this->file->headers['content-type'], ';')) !== false)
 1399:             {
 1400:                 $official = substr($this->file->headers['content-type'], 0, $pos);
 1401:             }
 1402:             else
 1403:             {
 1404:                 $official = $this->file->headers['content-type'];
 1405:             }
 1406:             $official = trim(strtolower($official));
 1407: 
 1408:             if ($official === 'unknown/unknown'
 1409:                 || $official === 'application/unknown')
 1410:             {
 1411:                 return $this->unknown();
 1412:             }
 1413:             elseif (substr($official, -4) === '+xml'
 1414:                 || $official === 'text/xml'
 1415:                 || $official === 'application/xml')
 1416:             {
 1417:                 return $official;
 1418:             }
 1419:             elseif (substr($official, 0, 6) === 'image/')
 1420:             {
 1421:                 if ($return = $this->image())
 1422:                 {
 1423:                     return $return;
 1424:                 }
 1425:                 else
 1426:                 {
 1427:                     return $official;
 1428:                 }
 1429:             }
 1430:             elseif ($official === 'text/html')
 1431:             {
 1432:                 return $this->feed_or_html();
 1433:             }
 1434:             else
 1435:             {
 1436:                 return $official;
 1437:             }
 1438:         }
 1439:         else
 1440:         {
 1441:             return $this->unknown();
 1442:         }
 1443:     }
 1444: 
 1445:     /**
 1446:      * Sniff text or binary
 1447:      *
 1448:      * @return string Actual Content-Type
 1449:      */
 1450:     public function text_or_binary()
 1451:     {
 1452:         if (substr($this->file->body, 0, 2) === "\xFE\xFF"
 1453:             || substr($this->file->body, 0, 2) === "\xFF\xFE"
 1454:             || substr($this->file->body, 0, 4) === "\x00\x00\xFE\xFF"
 1455:             || substr($this->file->body, 0, 3) === "\xEF\xBB\xBF")
 1456:         {
 1457:             return 'text/plain';
 1458:         }
 1459:         elseif (preg_match('/[\x00-\x08\x0E-\x1A\x1C-\x1F]/', $this->file->body))
 1460:         {
 1461:             return 'application/octect-stream';
 1462:         }
 1463:         else
 1464:         {
 1465:             return 'text/plain';
 1466:         }
 1467:     }
 1468: 
 1469:     /**
 1470:      * Sniff unknown
 1471:      *
 1472:      * @return string Actual Content-Type
 1473:      */
 1474:     public function unknown()
 1475:     {
 1476:         $ws = strspn($this->file->body, "\x09\x0A\x0B\x0C\x0D\x20");
 1477:         if (strtolower(substr($this->file->body, $ws, 14)) === '<!doctype html'
 1478:             || strtolower(substr($this->file->body, $ws, 5)) === '<html'
 1479:             || strtolower(substr($this->file->body, $ws, 7)) === '<script')
 1480:         {
 1481:             return 'text/html';
 1482:         }
 1483:         elseif (substr($this->file->body, 0, 5) === '%PDF-')
 1484:         {
 1485:             return 'application/pdf';
 1486:         }
 1487:         elseif (substr($this->file->body, 0, 11) === '%!PS-Adobe-')
 1488:         {
 1489:             return 'application/postscript';
 1490:         }
 1491:         elseif (substr($this->file->body, 0, 6) === 'GIF87a'
 1492:             || substr($this->file->body, 0, 6) === 'GIF89a')
 1493:         {
 1494:             return 'image/gif';
 1495:         }
 1496:         elseif (substr($this->file->body, 0, 8) === "\x89\x50\x4E\x47\x0D\x0A\x1A\x0A")
 1497:         {
 1498:             return 'image/png';
 1499:         }
 1500:         elseif (substr($this->file->body, 0, 3) === "\xFF\xD8\xFF")
 1501:         {
 1502:             return 'image/jpeg';
 1503:         }
 1504:         elseif (substr($this->file->body, 0, 2) === "\x42\x4D")
 1505:         {
 1506:             return 'image/bmp';
 1507:         }
 1508:         elseif (substr($this->file->body, 0, 4) === "\x00\x00\x01\x00")
 1509:         {
 1510:             return 'image/vnd.microsoft.icon';
 1511:         }
 1512:         else
 1513:         {
 1514:             return $this->text_or_binary();
 1515:         }
 1516:     }
 1517: 
 1518:     /**
 1519:      * Sniff images
 1520:      *
 1521:      * @return string Actual Content-Type
 1522:      */
 1523:     public function image()
 1524:     {
 1525:         if (substr($this->file->body, 0, 6) === 'GIF87a'
 1526:             || substr($this->file->body, 0, 6) === 'GIF89a')
 1527:         {
 1528:             return 'image/gif';
 1529:         }
 1530:         elseif (substr($this->file->body, 0, 8) === "\x89\x50\x4E\x47\x0D\x0A\x1A\x0A")
 1531:         {
 1532:             return 'image/png';
 1533:         }
 1534:         elseif (substr($this->file->body, 0, 3) === "\xFF\xD8\xFF")
 1535:         {
 1536:             return 'image/jpeg';
 1537:         }
 1538:         elseif (substr($this->file->body, 0, 2) === "\x42\x4D")
 1539:         {
 1540:             return 'image/bmp';
 1541:         }
 1542:         elseif (substr($this->file->body, 0, 4) === "\x00\x00\x01\x00")
 1543:         {
 1544:             return 'image/vnd.microsoft.icon';
 1545:         }
 1546:         else
 1547:         {
 1548:             return false;
 1549:         }
 1550:     }
 1551: 
 1552:     /**
 1553:      * Sniff HTML
 1554:      *
 1555:      * @return string Actual Content-Type
 1556:      */
 1557:     public function feed_or_html()
 1558:     {
 1559:         $len = strlen($this->file->body);
 1560:         $pos = strspn($this->file->body, "\x09\x0A\x0D\x20");
 1561: 
 1562:         while ($pos < $len)
 1563:         {
 1564:             switch ($this->file->body[$pos])
 1565:             {
 1566:                 case "\x09":
 1567:                 case "\x0A":
 1568:                 case "\x0D":
 1569:                 case "\x20":
 1570:                     $pos += strspn($this->file->body, "\x09\x0A\x0D\x20", $pos);
 1571:                     continue 2;
 1572: 
 1573:                 case '<':
 1574:                     $pos++;
 1575:                     break;
 1576: 
 1577:                 default:
 1578:                     return 'text/html';
 1579:             }
 1580: 
 1581:             if (substr($this->file->body, $pos, 3) === '!--')
 1582:             {
 1583:                 $pos += 3;
 1584:                 if ($pos < $len && ($pos = strpos($this->file->body, '-->', $pos)) !== false)
 1585:                 {
 1586:                     $pos += 3;
 1587:                 }
 1588:                 else
 1589:                 {
 1590:                     return 'text/html';
 1591:                 }
 1592:             }
 1593:             elseif (substr($this->file->body, $pos, 1) === '!')
 1594:             {
 1595:                 if ($pos < $len && ($pos = strpos($this->file->body, '>', $pos)) !== false)
 1596:                 {
 1597:                     $pos++;
 1598:                 }
 1599:                 else
 1600:                 {
 1601:                     return 'text/html';
 1602:                 }
 1603:             }
 1604:             elseif (substr($this->file->body, $pos, 1) === '?')
 1605:             {
 1606:                 if ($pos < $len && ($pos = strpos($this->file->body, '?>', $pos)) !== false)
 1607:                 {
 1608:                     $pos += 2;
 1609:                 }
 1610:                 else
 1611:                 {
 1612:                     return 'text/html';
 1613:                 }
 1614:             }
 1615:             elseif (substr($this->file->body, $pos, 3) === 'rss'
 1616:                 || substr($this->file->body, $pos, 7) === 'rdf:RDF')
 1617:             {
 1618:                 return 'application/rss+xml';
 1619:             }
 1620:             elseif (substr($this->file->body, $pos, 4) === 'feed')
 1621:             {
 1622:                 return 'application/atom+xml';
 1623:             }
 1624:             else
 1625:             {
 1626:                 return 'text/html';
 1627:             }
 1628:         }
 1629: 
 1630:         return 'text/html';
 1631:     }
 1632: }
 1633: 
 1634: /**
 1635:  * Manages `<media:copyright>` copyright tags as defined in Media RSS
 1636:  *
 1637:  * Used by {@see SimplePie_Enclosure::get_copyright()}
 1638:  *
 1639:  * This class can be overloaded with {@see SimplePie::set_copyright_class()}
 1640:  *
 1641:  * @package SimplePie
 1642:  */
 1643: class SimplePie_Copyright
 1644: {
 1645:     /**
 1646:      * Copyright URL
 1647:      *
 1648:      * @var string
 1649:      * @see get_url()
 1650:      */
 1651:     var $url;
 1652: 
 1653:     /**
 1654:      * Attribution
 1655:      *
 1656:      * @var string
 1657:      * @see get_attribution()
 1658:      */
 1659:     var $label;
 1660: 
 1661:     /**
 1662:      * Constructor, used to input the data
 1663:      *
 1664:      * For documentation on all the parameters, see the corresponding
 1665:      * properties and their accessors
 1666:      */
 1667:     public function __construct($url = null, $label = null)
 1668:     {
 1669:         $this->url = $url;
 1670:         $this->label = $label;
 1671:     }
 1672: 
 1673:     /**
 1674:      * String-ified version
 1675:      *
 1676:      * @return string
 1677:      */
 1678:     public function __toString()
 1679:     {
 1680:         // There is no $this->data here
 1681:         return md5(serialize($this));
 1682:     }
 1683: 
 1684:     /**
 1685:      * Get the copyright URL
 1686:      *
 1687:      * @return string|null URL to copyright information
 1688:      */
 1689:     public function get_url()
 1690:     {
 1691:         if ($this->url !== null)
 1692:         {
 1693:             return $this->url;
 1694:         }
 1695:         else
 1696:         {
 1697:             return null;
 1698:         }
 1699:     }
 1700: 
 1701:     /**
 1702:      * Get the attribution text
 1703:      *
 1704:      * @return string|null
 1705:      */
 1706:     public function get_attribution()
 1707:     {
 1708:         if ($this->label !== null)
 1709:         {
 1710:             return $this->label;
 1711:         }
 1712:         else
 1713:         {
 1714:             return null;
 1715:         }
 1716:     }
 1717: }
 1718: 
 1719: /**
 1720:  * SimplePie Name
 1721:  */
 1722: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAME', 'SimplePie');
 1723: 
 1724: /**
 1725:  * SimplePie Version
 1726:  */
 1727: define('SIMPLEPIE_VERSION', '1.3-dev');
 1728: 
 1729: /**
 1730:  * SimplePie Build
 1731:  * @todo Hardcode for release (there's no need to have to call SimplePie_Misc::get_build() only every load of simplepie.inc)
 1732:  */
 1733: define('SIMPLEPIE_BUILD', '20120411051355');
 1734: 
 1735: /**
 1736:  * SimplePie Website URL
 1737:  */
 1738: define('SIMPLEPIE_URL', 'http://simplepie.org');
 1739: 
 1740: /**
 1741:  * SimplePie Useragent
 1742:  * @see SimplePie::set_useragent()
 1743:  */
 1744: define('SIMPLEPIE_USERAGENT', SIMPLEPIE_NAME . '/' . SIMPLEPIE_VERSION . ' (Feed Parser; ' . SIMPLEPIE_URL . '; Allow like Gecko) Build/' . SIMPLEPIE_BUILD);
 1745: 
 1746: /**
 1747:  * SimplePie Linkback
 1748:  */
 1749: define('SIMPLEPIE_LINKBACK', '<a href="' . SIMPLEPIE_URL . '" title="' . SIMPLEPIE_NAME . ' ' . SIMPLEPIE_VERSION . '">' . SIMPLEPIE_NAME . '</a>');
 1750: 
 1751: /**
 1752:  * No Autodiscovery
 1753:  * @see SimplePie::set_autodiscovery_level()
 1754:  */
 1755: define('SIMPLEPIE_LOCATOR_NONE', 0);
 1756: 
 1757: /**
 1758:  * Feed Link Element Autodiscovery
 1759:  * @see SimplePie::set_autodiscovery_level()
 1760:  */
 1761: define('SIMPLEPIE_LOCATOR_AUTODISCOVERY', 1);
 1762: 
 1763: /**
 1764:  * Local Feed Extension Autodiscovery
 1765:  * @see SimplePie::set_autodiscovery_level()
 1766:  */
 1767: define('SIMPLEPIE_LOCATOR_LOCAL_EXTENSION', 2);
 1768: 
 1769: /**
 1770:  * Local Feed Body Autodiscovery
 1771:  * @see SimplePie::set_autodiscovery_level()
 1772:  */
 1773: define('SIMPLEPIE_LOCATOR_LOCAL_BODY', 4);
 1774: 
 1775: /**
 1776:  * Remote Feed Extension Autodiscovery
 1777:  * @see SimplePie::set_autodiscovery_level()
 1778:  */
 1779: define('SIMPLEPIE_LOCATOR_REMOTE_EXTENSION', 8);
 1780: 
 1781: /**
 1782:  * Remote Feed Body Autodiscovery
 1783:  * @see SimplePie::set_autodiscovery_level()
 1784:  */
 1785: define('SIMPLEPIE_LOCATOR_REMOTE_BODY', 16);
 1786: 
 1787: /**
 1788:  * All Feed Autodiscovery
 1789:  * @see SimplePie::set_autodiscovery_level()
 1790:  */
 1791: define('SIMPLEPIE_LOCATOR_ALL', 31);
 1792: 
 1793: /**
 1794:  * No known feed type
 1795:  */
 1796: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_NONE', 0);
 1797: 
 1798: /**
 1799:  * RSS 0.90
 1800:  */
 1801: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_RSS_090', 1);
 1802: 
 1803: /**
 1804:  * RSS 0.91 (Netscape)
 1805:  */
 1806: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_RSS_091_NETSCAPE', 2);
 1807: 
 1808: /**
 1809:  * RSS 0.91 (Userland)
 1810:  */
 1811: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_RSS_091_USERLAND', 4);
 1812: 
 1813: /**
 1814:  * RSS 0.91 (both Netscape and Userland)
 1815:  */
 1816: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_RSS_091', 6);
 1817: 
 1818: /**
 1819:  * RSS 0.92
 1820:  */
 1821: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_RSS_092', 8);
 1822: 
 1823: /**
 1824:  * RSS 0.93
 1825:  */
 1826: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_RSS_093', 16);
 1827: 
 1828: /**
 1829:  * RSS 0.94
 1830:  */
 1831: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_RSS_094', 32);
 1832: 
 1833: /**
 1834:  * RSS 1.0
 1835:  */
 1836: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_RSS_10', 64);
 1837: 
 1838: /**
 1839:  * RSS 2.0
 1840:  */
 1841: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_RSS_20', 128);
 1842: 
 1843: /**
 1844:  * RDF-based RSS
 1845:  */
 1846: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_RSS_RDF', 65);
 1847: 
 1848: /**
 1849:  * Non-RDF-based RSS (truly intended as syndication format)
 1850:  */
 1851: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_RSS_SYNDICATION', 190);
 1852: 
 1853: /**
 1854:  * All RSS
 1855:  */
 1856: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_RSS_ALL', 255);
 1857: 
 1858: /**
 1859:  * Atom 0.3
 1860:  */
 1861: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_ATOM_03', 256);
 1862: 
 1863: /**
 1864:  * Atom 1.0
 1865:  */
 1866: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_ATOM_10', 512);
 1867: 
 1868: /**
 1869:  * All Atom
 1870:  */
 1871: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_ATOM_ALL', 768);
 1872: 
 1873: /**
 1874:  * All feed types
 1875:  */
 1876: define('SIMPLEPIE_TYPE_ALL', 1023);
 1877: 
 1878: /**
 1879:  * No construct
 1880:  */
 1881: define('SIMPLEPIE_CONSTRUCT_NONE', 0);
 1882: 
 1883: /**
 1884:  * Text construct
 1885:  */
 1886: define('SIMPLEPIE_CONSTRUCT_TEXT', 1);
 1887: 
 1888: /**
 1889:  * HTML construct
 1890:  */
 1891: define('SIMPLEPIE_CONSTRUCT_HTML', 2);
 1892: 
 1893: /**
 1894:  * XHTML construct
 1895:  */
 1896: define('SIMPLEPIE_CONSTRUCT_XHTML', 4);
 1897: 
 1898: /**
 1899:  * base64-encoded construct
 1900:  */
 1901: define('SIMPLEPIE_CONSTRUCT_BASE64', 8);
 1902: 
 1903: /**
 1904:  * IRI construct
 1905:  */
 1906: define('SIMPLEPIE_CONSTRUCT_IRI', 16);
 1907: 
 1908: /**
 1909:  * A construct that might be HTML
 1910:  */
 1911: define('SIMPLEPIE_CONSTRUCT_MAYBE_HTML', 32);
 1912: 
 1913: /**
 1914:  * All constructs
 1915:  */
 1916: define('SIMPLEPIE_CONSTRUCT_ALL', 63);
 1917: 
 1918: /**
 1919:  * Don't change case
 1920:  */
 1921: define('SIMPLEPIE_SAME_CASE', 1);
 1922: 
 1923: /**
 1924:  * Change to lowercase
 1925:  */
 1926: define('SIMPLEPIE_LOWERCASE', 2);
 1927: 
 1928: /**
 1929:  * Change to uppercase
 1930:  */
 1931: define('SIMPLEPIE_UPPERCASE', 4);
 1932: 
 1933: /**
 1934:  * PCRE for HTML attributes
 1935:  */
 1936: define('SIMPLEPIE_PCRE_HTML_ATTRIBUTE', '((?:[\x09\x0A\x0B\x0C\x0D\x20]+[^\x09\x0A\x0B\x0C\x0D\x20\x2F\x3E][^\x09\x0A\x0B\x0C\x0D\x20\x2F\x3D\x3E]*(?:[\x09\x0A\x0B\x0C\x0D\x20]*=[\x09\x0A\x0B\x0C\x0D\x20]*(?:"(?:[^"]*)"|\'(?:[^\']*)\'|(?:[^\x09\x0A\x0B\x0C\x0D\x20\x22\x27\x3E][^\x09\x0A\x0B\x0C\x0D\x20\x3E]*)?))?)*)[\x09\x0A\x0B\x0C\x0D\x20]*');
 1937: 
 1938: /**
 1939:  * PCRE for XML attributes
 1940:  */
 1941: define('SIMPLEPIE_PCRE_XML_ATTRIBUTE', '((?:\s+(?:(?:[^\s:]+:)?[^\s:]+)\s*=\s*(?:"(?:[^"]*)"|\'(?:[^\']*)\'))*)\s*');
 1942: 
 1943: /**
 1944:  * XML Namespace
 1945:  */
 1946: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_XML', 'http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace');
 1947: 
 1948: /**
 1949:  * Atom 1.0 Namespace
 1950:  */
 1951: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_10', 'http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom');
 1952: 
 1953: /**
 1954:  * Atom 0.3 Namespace
 1955:  */
 1956: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ATOM_03', 'http://purl.org/atom/ns#');
 1957: 
 1958: /**
 1959:  * RDF Namespace
 1960:  */
 1961: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RDF', 'http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#');
 1962: 
 1963: /**
 1964:  * RSS 0.90 Namespace
 1965:  */
 1966: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_090', 'http://my.netscape.com/rdf/simple/0.9/');
 1967: 
 1968: /**
 1969:  * RSS 1.0 Namespace
 1970:  */
 1971: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_10', 'http://purl.org/rss/1.0/');
 1972: 
 1973: /**
 1974:  * RSS 1.0 Content Module Namespace
 1975:  */
 1976: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_10_MODULES_CONTENT', 'http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/');
 1977: 
 1978: /**
 1979:  * RSS 2.0 Namespace
 1980:  * (Stupid, I know, but I'm certain it will confuse people less with support.)
 1981:  */
 1982: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_RSS_20', '');
 1983: 
 1984: /**
 1985:  * DC 1.0 Namespace
 1986:  */
 1987: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_DC_10', 'http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.0/');
 1988: 
 1989: /**
 1990:  * DC 1.1 Namespace
 1991:  */
 1992: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_DC_11', 'http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/');
 1993: 
 1994: /**
 1995:  * W3C Basic Geo (WGS84 lat/long) Vocabulary Namespace
 1996:  */
 1997: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_W3C_BASIC_GEO', 'http://www.w3.org/2003/01/geo/wgs84_pos#');
 1998: 
 1999: /**
 2000:  * GeoRSS Namespace
 2001:  */
 2002: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_GEORSS', 'http://www.georss.org/georss');
 2003: 
 2004: /**
 2005:  * Media RSS Namespace
 2006:  */
 2007: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_MEDIARSS', 'http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/');
 2008: 
 2009: /**
 2010:  * Wrong Media RSS Namespace. Caused by a long-standing typo in the spec.
 2011:  */
 2012: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_MEDIARSS_WRONG', 'http://search.yahoo.com/mrss');
 2013: 
 2014: /**
 2015:  * Wrong Media RSS Namespace #2. New namespace introduced in Media RSS 1.5.
 2016:  */
 2017: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_MEDIARSS_WRONG2', 'http://video.search.yahoo.com/mrss');
 2018: 
 2019: /**
 2020:  * Wrong Media RSS Namespace #3. A possible typo of the Media RSS 1.5 namespace.
 2021:  */
 2022: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_MEDIARSS_WRONG3', 'http://video.search.yahoo.com/mrss/');
 2023: 
 2024: /**
 2025:  * Wrong Media RSS Namespace #4. New spec location after the RSS Advisory Board takes it over, but not a valid namespace.
 2026:  */
 2027: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_MEDIARSS_WRONG4', 'http://www.rssboard.org/media-rss');
 2028: 
 2029: /**
 2030:  * Wrong Media RSS Namespace #5. A possible typo of the RSS Advisory Board URL.
 2031:  */
 2032: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_MEDIARSS_WRONG5', 'http://www.rssboard.org/media-rss/');
 2033: 
 2034: /**
 2035:  * iTunes RSS Namespace
 2036:  */
 2037: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_ITUNES', 'http://www.itunes.com/dtds/podcast-1.0.dtd');
 2038: 
 2039: /**
 2040:  * XHTML Namespace
 2041:  */
 2042: define('SIMPLEPIE_NAMESPACE_XHTML', 'http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml');
 2043: 
 2044: /**
 2045:  * IANA Link Relations Registry
 2046:  */
 2047: define('SIMPLEPIE_IANA_LINK_RELATIONS_REGISTRY', 'http://www.iana.org/assignments/relation/');
 2048: 
 2049: /**
 2050:  * Whether we're running on PHP5
 2051:  */
 2052: define('SIMPLEPIE_PHP5', version_compare(PHP_VERSION, '5.0.0', '>='));
 2053: 
 2054: /**
 2055:  * No file source
 2056:  */
 2057: define('SIMPLEPIE_FILE_SOURCE_NONE', 0);
 2058: 
 2059: /**
 2060:  * Remote file source
 2061:  */
 2062: define('SIMPLEPIE_FILE_SOURCE_REMOTE', 1);
 2063: 
 2064: /**
 2065:  * Local file source
 2066:  */
 2067: define('SIMPLEPIE_FILE_SOURCE_LOCAL', 2);
 2068: 
 2069: /**
 2070:  * fsockopen() file source
 2071:  */
 2072: define('SIMPLEPIE_FILE_SOURCE_FSOCKOPEN', 4);
 2073: 
 2074: /**
 2075:  * cURL file source
 2076:  */
 2077: define('SIMPLEPIE_FILE_SOURCE_CURL', 8);
 2078: 
 2079: /**
 2080:  * file_get_contents() file source
 2081:  */
 2082: define('SIMPLEPIE_FILE_SOURCE_FILE_GET_CONTENTS', 16);
 2083: 
 2084: /**
 2085:  * SimplePie
 2086:  *
 2087:  * @package SimplePie
 2088:  */
 2089: class SimplePie_Core
 2090: {
 2091:     /**
 2092:      * @var array Raw data
 2093:      * @access private
 2094:      */
 2095:     public $data = array();
 2096: 
 2097:     /**
 2098:      * @var mixed Error string
 2099:      * @access private
 2100:      */
 2101:     public $error;
 2102: 
 2103:     /**
 2104:      * @var object Instance of SimplePie_Sanitize (or other class)
 2105:      * @see SimplePie::set_sanitize_class()
 2106:      * @access private
 2107:      */
 2108:     public $sanitize;
 2109: 
 2110:     /**
 2111:      * @var string SimplePie Useragent
 2112:      * @see SimplePie::set_useragent()
 2113:      * @access private
 2114:      */
 2115:     public $useragent = SIMPLEPIE_USERAGENT;
 2116: 
 2117:     /**
 2118:      * @var string Feed URL
 2119:      * @see SimplePie::set_feed_url()
 2120:      * @access private
 2121:      */
 2122:     public $feed_url;
 2123: 
 2124:     /**
 2125:      * @var object Instance of SimplePie_File to use as a feed
 2126:      * @see SimplePie::set_file()
 2127:      * @access private
 2128:      */
 2129:     public $file;
 2130: 
 2131:     /**
 2132:      * @var string Raw feed data
 2133:      * @see SimplePie::set_raw_data()
 2134:      * @access private
 2135:      */
 2136:     public $raw_data;
 2137: 
 2138:     /**
 2139:      * @var int Timeout for fetching remote files
 2140:      * @see SimplePie::set_timeout()
 2141:      * @access private
 2142:      */
 2143:     public $timeout = 10;
 2144: 
 2145:     /**
 2146:      * @var bool Forces fsockopen() to be used for remote files instead
 2147:      * of cURL, even if a new enough version is installed
 2148:      * @see SimplePie::force_fsockopen()
 2149:      * @access private
 2150:      */
 2151:     public $force_fsockopen = false;
 2152: 
 2153:     /**
 2154:      * @var bool Force the given data/URL to be treated as a feed no matter what
 2155:      * it appears like
 2156:      * @see SimplePie::force_feed()
 2157:      * @access private
 2158:      */
 2159:     public $force_feed = false;
 2160: 
 2161:     /**
 2162:      * @var bool Enable/Disable XML dump
 2163:      * @see SimplePie::enable_xml_dump()
 2164:      * @access private
 2165:      */
 2166:     public $xml_dump = false;
 2167: 
 2168:     /**
 2169:      * @var bool Enable/Disable Caching
 2170:      * @see SimplePie::enable_cache()
 2171:      * @access private
 2172:      */
 2173:     public $cache = true;
 2174: 
 2175:     /**
 2176:      * @var int Cache duration (in seconds)
 2177:      * @see SimplePie::set_cache_duration()
 2178:      * @access private
 2179:      */
 2180:     public $cache_duration = 3600;
 2181: 
 2182:     /**
 2183:      * @var int Auto-discovery cache duration (in seconds)
 2184:      * @see SimplePie::set_autodiscovery_cache_duration()
 2185:      * @access private
 2186:      */
 2187:     public $autodiscovery_cache_duration = 604800; // 7 Days.
 2188: 
 2189:     /**
 2190:      * @var string Cache location (relative to executing script)
 2191:      * @see SimplePie::set_cache_location()
 2192:      * @access private
 2193:      */
 2194:     public $cache_location = './cache';
 2195: 
 2196:     /**
 2197:      * @var string Function that creates the cache filename
 2198:      * @see SimplePie::set_cache_name_function()
 2199:      * @access private
 2200:      */
 2201:     public $cache_name_function = 'md5';
 2202: 
 2203:     /**
 2204:      * @var bool Reorder feed by date descending
 2205:      * @see SimplePie::enable_order_by_date()
 2206:      * @access private
 2207:      */
 2208:     public $order_by_date = true;
 2209: 
 2210:     /**
 2211:      * @var mixed Force input encoding to be set to the follow value
 2212:      * (false, or anything type-cast to false, disables this feature)
 2213:      * @see SimplePie::set_input_encoding()
 2214:      * @access private
 2215:      */
 2216:     public $input_encoding = false;
 2217: 
 2218:     /**
 2219:      * @var int Feed Autodiscovery Level
 2220:      * @see SimplePie::set_autodiscovery_level()
 2221:      * @access private
 2222:      */
 2223:     public $autodiscovery = SIMPLEPIE_LOCATOR_ALL;
 2224: 
 2225:     public $registry;
 2226: 
 2227:     /**
 2228:      * @var int Maximum number of feeds to check with autodiscovery
 2229:      * @see SimplePie::set_max_checked_feeds()
 2230:      * @access private
 2231:      */
 2232:     public $max_checked_feeds = 10;
 2233: 
 2234:     /**
 2235:      * @var array All the feeds found during the autodiscovery process
 2236:      * @see SimplePie::get_all_discovered_feeds()
 2237:      * @access private
 2238:      */
 2239:     public $all_discovered_feeds = array();
 2240: 
 2241:     /**
 2242:      * @var string Web-accessible path to the handler_image.php file.
 2243:      * @see SimplePie::set_image_handler()
 2244:      * @access private
 2245:      */
 2246:     public $image_handler = '';
 2247: 
 2248:     /**
 2249:      * @var array Stores the URLs when multiple feeds are being initialized.
 2250:      * @see SimplePie::set_feed_url()
 2251:      * @access private
 2252:      */
 2253:     public $multifeed_url = array();
 2254: 
 2255:     /**
 2256:      * @var array Stores SimplePie objects when multiple feeds initialized.
 2257:      * @access private
 2258:      */
 2259:     public $multifeed_objects = array();
 2260: 
 2261:     /**
 2262:      * @var array Stores the get_object_vars() array for use with multifeeds.
 2263:      * @see SimplePie::set_feed_url()
 2264:      * @access private
 2265:      */
 2266:     public $config_settings = null;
 2267: 
 2268:     /**
 2269:      * @var integer Stores the number of items to return per-feed with multifeeds.
 2270:      * @see SimplePie::set_item_limit()
 2271:      * @access private
 2272:      */
 2273:     public $item_limit = 0;
 2274: 
 2275:     /**
 2276:      * @var array Stores the default attributes to be stripped by strip_attributes().
 2277:      * @see SimplePie::strip_attributes()
 2278:      * @access private
 2279:      */
 2280:     public $strip_attributes = array('bgsound', 'class', 'expr', 'id', 'style', 'onclick', 'onerror', 'onfinish', 'onmouseover', 'onmouseout', 'onfocus', 'onblur', 'lowsrc', 'dynsrc');
 2281: 
 2282:     /**
 2283:      * @var array Stores the default tags to be stripped by strip_htmltags().
 2284:      * @see SimplePie::strip_htmltags()
 2285:      * @access private
 2286:      */
 2287:     public $strip_htmltags = array('base', 'blink', 'body', 'doctype', 'embed', 'font', 'form', 'frame', 'frameset', 'html', 'iframe', 'input', 'marquee', 'meta', 'noscript', 'object', 'param', 'script', 'style');
 2288: 
 2289:     /**
 2290:      * The SimplePie class contains feed level data and options
 2291:      *
 2292:      * There are two ways that you can create a new SimplePie object. The first
 2293:      * is by passing a feed URL as a parameter to the SimplePie constructor
 2294:      * (as well as optionally setting the cache location and cache expiry). This
 2295:      * will initialise the whole feed with all of the default settings, and you
 2296:      * can begin accessing methods and properties immediately.
 2297:      *
 2298:      * The second way is to create the SimplePie object with no parameters
 2299:      * at all. This will enable you to set configuration options. After setting
 2300:      * them, you must initialise the feed using $feed->init(). At that point the
 2301:      * object's methods and properties will be available to you. This format is
 2302:      * what is used throughout this documentation.
 2303:      *
 2304:      * @access public
 2305:      * @since 1.0 Preview Release
 2306:      */
 2307:     public function __construct()
 2308:     {
 2309:         if (version_compare(PHP_VERSION, '5.0', '<'))
 2310:         {
 2311:             trigger_error('PHP 4.x is no longer supported. Please upgrade to PHP 5.2 or newer.');
 2312:             die();
 2313:         }
 2314: 
 2315:         // Other objects, instances created here so we can set options on them
 2316:         $this->sanitize = new SimplePie_Sanitize();
 2317:         $this->registry = new SimplePie_Registry();
 2318: 
 2319:         if (func_num_args() > 0)
 2320:         {
 2321:             trigger_error('Passing parameters to the constructor is no longer supported. Please use set_feed_url(), set_cache_location(), and set_cache_location() directly.');
 2322:         }
 2323:     }
 2324: 
 2325:     /**
 2326:      * Used for converting object to a string
 2327:      */
 2328:     public function __toString()
 2329:     {
 2330:         return md5(serialize($this->data));
 2331:     }
 2332: 
 2333:     /**
 2334:      * Remove items that link back to this before destroying this object
 2335:      */
 2336:     public function __destruct()
 2337:     {
 2338:         if ((version_compare(PHP_VERSION, '5.3', '<') || !gc_enabled()) && !ini_get('zend.ze1_compatibility_mode'))
 2339:         {
 2340:             if (!empty($this->data['items']))
 2341:             {
 2342:                 foreach ($this->data['items'] as $item)
 2343:                 {
 2344:                     $item->__destruct();
 2345:                 }
 2346:                 unset($item, $this->data['items']);
 2347:             }
 2348:             if (!empty($this->data['ordered_items']))
 2349:             {
 2350:                 foreach ($this->data['ordered_items'] as $item)
 2351:                 {
 2352:                     $item->__destruct();
 2353:                 }
 2354:                 unset($item, $this->data['ordered_items']);
 2355:             }
 2356:         }
 2357:     }
 2358: 
 2359:     /**
 2360:      * Force the given data/URL to be treated as a feed no matter what it
 2361:      * appears like
 2362:      *
 2363:      * @access public
 2364:      * @since 1.1
 2365:      * @param bool $enable Force the given data/URL to be treated as a feed
 2366:      */
 2367:     public function force_feed($enable = false)
 2368:     {
 2369:         $this->force_feed = (bool) $enable;
 2370:     }
 2371: 
 2372:     /**
 2373:      * This is the URL of the feed you want to parse.
 2374:      *
 2375:      * This allows you to enter the URL of the feed you want to parse, or the
 2376:      * website you want to try to use auto-discovery on. This takes priority
 2377:      * over any set raw data.
 2378:      *
 2379:      * You can set multiple feeds to mash together by passing an array instead
 2380:      * of a string for the $url. Remember that with each additional feed comes
 2381:      * additional processing and resources.
 2382:      *
 2383:      * @access public
 2384:      * @since 1.0 Preview Release
 2385:      * @param mixed $url This is the URL (or array of URLs) that you want to parse.
 2386:      * @see SimplePie::set_raw_data()
 2387:      */
 2388:     public function set_feed_url($url)
 2389:     {
 2390:         $this->multifeed_url = array();
 2391:         if (is_array($url))
 2392:         {
 2393:             foreach ($url as $value)
 2394:             {
 2395:                 $this->multifeed_url[] = $this->registry->call('Misc', 'fix_protocol', array($value, 1));
 2396:             }
 2397:         }
 2398:         else
 2399:         {
 2400:             $this->feed_url = $this->registry->call('Misc', 'fix_protocol', array($url, 1));
 2401:         }
 2402:     }
 2403: 
 2404:     /**
 2405:      * Provides an instance of SimplePie_File to use as a feed
 2406:      *
 2407:      * @access public
 2408:      * @param object &$file Instance of SimplePie_File (or subclass)
 2409:      * @return bool True on success, false on failure
 2410:      */
 2411:     public function set_file(&$file)
 2412:     {
 2413:         if ($file instanceof SimplePie_File)
 2414:         {
 2415:             $this->feed_url = $file->url;
 2416:             $this->file =& $file;
 2417:             return true;
 2418:         }
 2419:         return false;
 2420:     }
 2421: 
 2422:     /**
 2423:      * Allows you to use a string of RSS/Atom data instead of a remote feed.
 2424:      *
 2425:      * If you have a feed available as a string in PHP, you can tell SimplePie
 2426:      * to parse that data string instead of a remote feed. Any set feed URL
 2427:      * takes precedence.
 2428:      *
